alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Marion; Newton; Pope; Searcy; Van Buren (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 8:39AM CDT until March 30 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Johnson County in western Arkansas... Searcy County in north central Arkansas... Southeastern Newton County in north central Arkansas... Southeastern Marion County in north central Arkansas... Northwestern Van Buren County in north central Arkansas... Northern Pope County in central Arkansas... * Until 930 AM CDT. * At 838 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Walnut to near Dillen to Holman, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Marshall... Marsena... Witts Spring... Rocky Hill... Duff... Moore... Dabney... Point Peter... Maumee... Bohannon... Imo... Watts... Holman... Kay... Dillen... Solo... Smyrna... Rush... Eula... Woolum... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for western, central and north central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for western, central and north central Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Johnson; Marion; Newton; Pope; Searcy; Van Buren
